isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - PRESSURE PROTECTION VALVE - SERVICE CHECKS

svcproc.title: SERVICE CHECKS

step1.para: Be sure the vent hole is not obstructed.

Disconnect the air outlet side of valve. Install an accurate air pressure gauge with a shut-off valve. Start engine and allow air pressure to build up. Observe gauge on instrument panel and at valve outlet.

caution.para: Only test gauges known to be accurate are to be used for checking brake valve delivery pressures, gover- nor pressure settings and other tests.

You should not have air pressure at test gauge until main air reservoir pressure reaches 65 to 75 psi. Then the pressure protection valve opens and both test gauge and gauge on vehicle should record approximately the same.

step1.para: Stop engine and open the shut-off valve at test gauge. Air should exhaust until air pressure on vehicle reaches a pressure of approximately 20 psi below opening pressure, then close shut-off valve. If the valve performs as described, the valve is functioning properly.

svcproc.para: Bleed off main air reservoir pressure and remove shut-off valve and test gauge. Reconnect line to the auxiliary equipment.
